Package org.roxbotix.elibs2.robot.components

Class Encoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.roxbotix.elibs2.robot.components.RbComponent
      • org.roxbotix.elibs2.robot.components.Encoder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    me.wobblyyyy.ezpos.EncoderInterface, EncoderCore, LfComponent
    public class Encoder
extends RbComponent
implements EncoderCore, me.wobblyyyy.ezpos.EncoderInterface
    An abstraction of encoders, designed to provide a bit more utility.
    Author:
    Colin Robertson

    • Field Detail

      • REVERSE_DIRECTION

        private static final boolean REVERSE_DIRECTION
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • current

        private int current
        The encoder's current position.

        This number is only ever accessed after it's been updated, meaning it's checked for min and max and the offset value is applied.

      • organic

        private int organic
        The encoder's current position.

        This time, without any modification. This is the number as it's reported from the encoder whenever an update occurs.

      • max

        private int max
        The maximum value the encoder can reach before it's capped.

      • min

        private int min
        The minimum value the encoder can reach.

      • encoder

        private final edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Encoder encoder

      • offset

        private int offset
        The offset the encoder uses before its values are accessible.

        A positive offset means that the output value will be higher than the original input value.

        A negative offset means that the output value will be lower than the original input value.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Encoder

        public Encoder​(int channelA,
               int channelB)
        Encoder constructor. Create a new encoder with A and B channels.

        The encoder will start counting immediately after it's created.

        Parameters:
        channelA - the A channel DIO channel. Channels 0-9 are on-board, channels 10-25 are on the MXP port.
        channelB - the B channel DIO channel. Channels 0-9 are on-board, channel 10-25 are on the MXP port.

      • Encoder

        public Encoder​(int channelA,
               int channelB,
               boolean reverseDirection)
        Encoder constructor. Construct a Encoder given a and b channels.

        The encoder will start counting immediately.

        Parameters:
        channelA - The a channel DIO channel. 0-9 are on-board, 10-25 are on the MXP port
        channelB - The b channel DIO channel. 0-9 are on-board, 10-25 are on the MXP port
        reverseDirection - represents the orientation of the encoder and inverts the output values if necessary so forward represents positive values.

      • Encoder

        public Encoder​(int channelA,
               int channelB,
               int indexChannel,
               boolean reverseDirection)
        Encoder constructor. Construct a Encoder given a and b channels. Using an index pulse forces 4x encoding

        The encoder will start counting immediately.

        Parameters:
        channelA - The a channel digital input channel.
        channelB - The b channel digital input channel.
        indexChannel - The index channel digital input channel.
        reverseDirection - represents the orientation of the encoder and inverts the output values if necessary so forward represents positive values.

        public void init()
        Description copied from interface: LfComponent
        Initialize the component.

        All components must be initialized before use. Not initializing a component means it won't work. Having a component that doesn't work... Well, let's just say that's not exactly beneficial to you.
